intro: Zizaniopsis bonariensis, commonly known as the common barnyard grass, is an annual grass species native to South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Due to its aggressive growth, it is considered a weed in many regions.
